name: plug.dj - Transparent dashboard and store
description:
This style makes the dashboard entirely transparent, for those who want to apply a background to that part of the website and further make transparent the dashboard interface and avatar store.

This style also works at the communities section accessible within the plug.dj menu, so you can see whatever's playing as you browse. This also completes the avatar store by making its cells transparent.
obsoletion_message: plug.dj is now a Rowl-owned asset, and has returned to business.
additional_info: Information You'll want to use this with some modification. Follow instructions on how to modify for use with dashboard. Also see these other styles; Transparent UI Transparent buttons and menus Transparent playlist and user menus Transparent dialog boxes Transparent miscellany This style will make transparent what is left of the unaffected dashboard and also apply transparency with the avatar store and community cells. 12/10/14 I forgot to add a comma somewhere, and I made the create community button use blue text. 12/17/14 Added new code that pertained to this style, to accommodate for the recent interface update. Also, added code for later use with Transparent dialogs. 12/18/14 Fixed an unexpected bug in the purchase dialog with a little more code. 12/31/14 New Year's update! Code has been modified to include the "Extras shop" cells, as well, code for both purchasing avatars and name change. 01/16/14 Slight edit to enable background image exclusion for more than just the change username extra, but also to keep the avatar purchase dialog from losing its background. 01/19/15 Small bundle cell tweak. 04/10/15 Added stuff for the new expiration notices and fixed up the inventory section a bit. 06/20/15 Added transparent dashboard border button. Will look a little weird without Transparent UI. Bugs - Community cells cannot be easily made transparent because of the default behavior I had to work around. There is also a bit of overlap happening with the background elements at the bottom due to the workaround I chose to use. - Community previews are smaller because they kind of had to be. Aside from that, no other problems exist.
